summary: Entrepreneur, speaker, ideator & thinker bringing the fractional & decentralized leadership model into the future of work. I‚Äôm a Fractional Futurist, helping fractional executives build million-dollar firms they can scale and eventually exit. Going from 0‚Äì1 is hard. Shifting from freelancer to founder is harder. That‚Äôs where I come in‚Äîwith strategy, structure, and the FROST Framework. I‚Äôm the co-founder of yorCMO, the first decentralized leadership franchise for fractional CMOs. And now, I‚Äôm scaling FractionalPros.com, a platform that connects SMBs with vetted fractional leaders‚Äîand helps those leaders find visibility, leads, and community through niche-driven peer pods. I believe in decentralized teams, strategic clarity, and the idea that every expert deserves a business model that works for them, not just because of them. I‚Äôve had a non-linear career and life. I‚Äôve: - Started a lawn care service in high school and sold the business before college - Studied and worked in chemical engineering - Founded 4 companies: from mortgage financing to media to data haptics tech - Published and written a book on media habits - Taught Entrepreneurship to university students - Created a documentary film on the seasons of entrepreneurship - Launched a community for fractional pros I spent years attempting to reconcile my wildly diverse experiences, let alone trying to explain them to those around me. Eventually, I realized that my decentralized nature was an asset: I could help other entrepreneurs engineer non-traditional, weird, unexpected and creative ideas into their businesses. Often it‚Äôs the simplest ideas that have the power to make a big impact & combust at scale. Board Member at Entrepreneurs‚Äô Organization (EO) Nebraska. I am also the host of a weekly podcast ‚ÄúThe Fractional C-Suite Retreat‚Äù featuring thought leaders on the future of work in the C-Suite. By day, professional tea and coffee drinker; by night, cigar enthusiast and living my best life with my wife and 4 children. headline: CEO | Founding Partner | Podcast & YouTube Host: The Future of Teamwork | Ecosystem Connector | Team Sense-Maker | Rugby Coach | Boundary Rider
summary: Over the years, I‚Äôve learned that the decisions we make as leaders ripple far beyond the boardroom. They shape careers, cultures, and communities... and, perhaps most importantly, they set an example for the people watching us most closely ‚Äî at work, and at home. I‚Äôve worn many hats: CEO, operating executive, advisor, dealmaker, coach, and podcast host. I‚Äôve led sales from $400 million to over $1 billion in an organic growth cycle, delivered 4x growth in six years, navigated more than a dozen acquisitions, and opened new markets. I‚Äôve worked in public companies, private equity-backed businesses, and family-owned enterprises in the middle of steep growth curves. The scale changes, but the through-line is always the same: connect great people, align them around a shared purpose, and give them the space to do their best work. That belief fuels my work at LEAD3R and as host of The Future of Teamwork Podcast, where I‚Äôve interviewed more than 150 leaders from every corner of the working world. Each conversation is a masterclass in leadership - part learning, part teaching, always a reminder that kindness and clarity are not mutually exclusive in high performance. These dialogues sharpen my own leadership style, helping me find new ways to guide teams that are both values-driven and results-focused. I‚Äôm endlessly fascinated by the changing shape of tomorrow‚Äôs workplace - how technology, community, and business can intersect to tackle big challenges like diversity and inclusion, skills transfer, innovation, and disruption. It‚Äôs a space where curiosity is an asset, and collaboration is both art and science. At this point in my career, I know two things for certain: great teams don‚Äôt happen by accident, and leadership is a privilege that comes with a responsibility to use it well. If you‚Äôre as interested in building purposeful teams and unlocking the potential of people as I am, I‚Äôd be glad to connect.

headline: Global Speaker * M&A Whisperer * #1 M&A Speaker/Consultant * HBR & Forbes Contributor * Author * MG100 * TEDx Speaker * Parkinson‚Äôs Caregiver
summary: If you are a CEO, entrepreneur or business owner pursuing mergers or acquisitions as part of your growth strategy, let‚Äôs talk. There‚Äôs a reason CEO's call me an "M&A Whisperer". The title comes from my work advising leaders and organizations on the "unexpected people challenges" of Mergers & Acquisitions. The challenges that can doom a deal but which rarely get covered in M&A preparedness training. I've been on all sides of the deal equation and show leaders what it takes to lead people through change and uncertainty. My leadership lessons came as an international C-Suite executive leading teams through three separate multibillion-dollar deals. I learned firsthand that M&A growth strategies suffer when leaders haven‚Äôt been prepared to guide their teams through the emotional roller-coaster that can occur post-deal. No wonder people struggle to pivot and adapt as quickly as management expects. These insights and lessons were captured in my best-selling M&A business book, "NOW WHAT? A Survivor‚Äôs Guide for Thriving Through Mergers & Acquisitions" which serves as a playbook for executives and handbook for frontline leaders balancing their day job with post-deal integration work. My M&A consultancy, Day1 Ready was founded on the premise that M is for Mindset and A is for Agile. Through one-day workshops and keynotes, I‚Äôve prepared hundreds of CEOs, executives and middle managers to recognize that success in M&A is not solely achieved by following static playbooks; success comes from having an adaptive mindset and an agile approach. Speaking on human capital strategies that drive M&A success, I‚Äôve guest lectured at the University of Chicago/Booth School of Business, Northwestern, and Thunderbird School of Global Management. I write a business leadership column for Forbes and contribute to Harvard Business Review, Fast Company, and Inc. Honored as Entrepreneur of the Year by Northshore Women in Business in 2019, I was recently ranked the #1 M&A Leadership Consultant by Leadership Research Institute and nominated to Thinkers50 2024 Radar list of future management thinkers to watch. Expertise: transition strategist; integration planning and execution; culture assimilation; change management; change communications; M&A on-boarding/off-boarding; brand identity and strategy; B2B marketing and communications Pursuing an M&A deal? headline: I help owners build businesses they never want to sell. | We Buy Texas Businesses | $250M+ in Transactions | Author of ‚ÄòUnlocking Small Business Value‚Äô
summary: I'm not an exit consultant. I help owners build businesses they never want to sell. (Ironically, that's exactly when buyers pay the most.) Most 'succession advisors' are former brokers who've never written a check. I've written millions in checks. ‚úÖ Bought businesses with my own money and advised buyers and sellers in over $250 million worth of small business deals. ‚úÖ Learned how to systematize and grow businesses to not depend on their owners to operate (on my own dime!) ‚úÖ Sold businesses to strategic buyers ‚úÖ Structured management buyouts that actually worked ‚úÖ Helped owners pass to family without destroying relationships ‚úÖ Come from a real-world, dirty fingernails, operational background, not a consultant who only knows spreadsheets. I've sat in every chair at the closing table. That's the difference. ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ THE UNCOMFORTABLE TRUTH: Your business is probably unsellable right now. - You're irreplaceable (buyers run from this) - Your financials tell three different stories - Your team would quit if you left tomorrow - You have no idea what you're actually worth But here's what most owners don't know: The changes that make your business sellable also make it more profitable TODAY. That's why smart owners start succession preparation years before they need it. Not to sell. But to have the OPTION to sell. ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ WHERE ARE YOU? üî¥ TRAPPED: "I can't take a real vacation without chaos" ‚Üí We build systems so the business runs without you üü° GROWING: "I need to scale but organic growth is too slow" ‚Üí We acquire competitors or expand strategically üü¢ PREPARING: "I want options but don't know where to start" ‚Üí We create your succession roadmap (family, management, or sale) ‚ö™ READY: "It's time. Get me the best outcome possible" ‚Üí We run a process that adds 30-50% to your value ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ THE BOTTOM LINE: I don't push anyone toward a sale. That's what brokers do. I help you build a business with options: - Option to run it forever (profitably) - Option to pass to family (smoothly) - Option to sell to management / employees (fairly) - Option to sell to a strategic (lucratively) No options = prison. Multiple options = freedom. üìä Find out where you stand: Send me a message and let's talk about where you are and where you want to be. üìö Or start with my book: "Unlocking Small Business Value" The playbook I wish I'd had for my first acquisition: https://grw.bz/unlock P.S. Still doing everything yourself? It's time to unlock some small business value. Drop me a note and we can talk through how to do that.

headline: Startup Strategist | Founder Performance Coach | Venture Design Trainer
summary: The founder makes the difference. Same idea, same market, similar traction‚Äîinvestors bet on the founder who can navigate extreme uncertainty without getting lost in the sauce. This is not trivial. Your job is hard. You're searching for a business model in a particular market that's never been built before, making strategic decisions without clear answers, designing a future company while staying grounded in present reality.Doing this competently requires a specific skillset that most people have never developed. It's about developing the capabilities to search systematically, design strategically, and make grounded decisions when there's no obvious path forward.I have been a founder performance coach for 11 years. I work with pre-seed through Series A founders who are playing the long game, building companies that matter. I help you develop those skills‚Äîusing a venture design framework that gives you structure for the search, context for prioritization, and confidence in your decisions.

summary: I help CEOs and executives move from being ‚Äúoperators who get things done‚Äù to being ‚Äúleaders who create advantage and lasting impact.‚Äù Who are you? Mid-level and senior executives who‚Äôve been told they ‚Äúneed to be more strategic.‚Äù Leaders who are strong operators but struggle to make the shift into strategic roles. Organizations that want their managers at all levels to think and act more strategically, not just execute. New CEOs and executives inheriting entrenched strategies who need to reshape thinking across their teams. 2. What keeps you up at night? Fear of being seen as ‚Äúnot strategic enough‚Äù and getting sidelined or even laid off. Overloaded agendas where everything feels urgent but little feels truly strategic. Frustration with plans that don‚Äôt move the organization forward‚Äîlots of initiatives, little impact. The weight of uncertainty and complexity‚Äînoise, turbulence, and competing priorities. Worry about losing influence, missing opportunities, or being blindsided by disruption. 3. What have you tried? Reading strategy books or attending planning-heavy courses that explain what strategy is but not how to be strategic. Creating long lists of initiatives and cascading them down through the org chart‚Äîonly to produce confusion and traffic jams. Traditional ‚Äústrategic planning‚Äù that focuses on budgets and targets instead of shaping thinking and decisions. Leaning on OKRs or similar tools that masquerade as strategy but don‚Äôt shift behavior or perspective. 4. The transformation you need? To be recognized as true strategic thinkers‚Äînot just operators who execute. To shift from reactive, tactical fire-fighting to enactive, purpose-driven leadership. To see complexity more clearly, prioritize effectively, and focus on leverage points for real impact. To gain influence in their organizations by connecting their work directly to strategy. To build confidence that they can navigate uncertainty and shape the future rather than just respond to it. How I Can Help: ‚ñ∂ CEO Coaching: Personalized coaching for CEOs and Business Unit leaders of 8+ figure businesses, designed to build robust systems for success. ‚ñ∂ Consulting: Strategy and consulting services for Fortune 500-1000 companies, including strategy development, digital transformation, M&A support, and performance improvement initiatives. ‚ñ∂ Online Training Programs: üí° Strategic Thinking For Advantage: A program for aspiring executives to sharpen their strategic skills. üèÜ Win Your Day: An online course sharing my productivity system to help you become more effective.

You need infrastructure‚Äîthe kind that scales clarity, trust, and execution without burning your team out. That‚Äôs where I come in. I‚Äôm a strategic advisor and fractional Chief People Officer. I partner with CEOs and executive teams to build the people infrastructure that makes leadership sustainable‚Äîand performance inevitable. job_description: WHY IT MATTERS: Cash flow is the life-blood of your business. Frustration leads to doubt and a business suffers as a result. Our clients are the size companies that hire the majority of people and pay most of the taxes in this country. However, these companies do not have consistent access to professional cash flow management that would help them in a time of need. That is where Newpoint comes in. CASE STUDY: Often companies are sent to us when they are in significant trouble. Our job is to move quickly to give them visibility to the issues and come up with viable solutions. We have worked with hundreds of companies that faced game changing decisions, like one mid-west based machine shop. They had been around for years, but since economic turmoil and some personal matters came up, they had not been able to turn a profit. Their lender was fatigued, but not totally ready to give up. We were able to work with management over a two week period of time, put together a Cash Flow Launcher‚Ñ¢ tool that showed where quick changes would solve the immediate issues. The result - their lender stuck with them. TAME‚Ñ¢ helped management see where some longer term changes would make them stronger. The rapid deployment of Newpoint's Proprietary Cash Flow Launcher coupled with professional insight from TAME‚Ñ¢ gave the company the tools to see in days what they had not been able to clear up for several years. STATISTICS: Since founding Newpoint in 2013, CFL‚Ñ¢ and TAME‚Ñ¢ have been able to help financiers recover $1,355,000,000 in debt and saved 13,414 jobs. headline: Partner, ON Partners/ Head of People + Talent Practice
summary: I‚Äôm an applied anthropologist, executive coach, and reticulist, dedicated to transforming how organizations navigate talent management, leadership, and culture. For over 17 years, I‚Äôve partnered with CEOs, executive teams, and boards across venture capital, private equity, and Fortune 100 companies to align people strategies with business strategies, creating cultures that drive performance and innovation. As a C-suite Advisor on Talent, I specialize in helping leaders thrive amid uncertainty. My approach is rooted in understanding the complex interplay between people and organizations‚Äîdesigning strategies that not only meet immediate business needs but also foster long-term growth and resilience. I‚Äôve had the privilege of consulting for global organizations, including Nike, Amazon, McKinsey, and Microsoft, as well as scaling startups, guiding them through inflection points that required deep leadership transformation and organizational redesign. Leadership, in my view, is not just about the individual; it‚Äôs about the intersection of culture, strategy, and human dynamics. By aligning human capital strategy with business objectives, organizations can navigate complexity and achieve sustainable success. I believe that trust, agility, and strategic talent development are essential for any organization looking to thrive in today‚Äôs rapidly changing landscape. As a reticulist, I bring together diverse, often unlikely, groups of people to create innovative solutions to today‚Äôs most pressing challenges. By convening different perspectives, I believe we can drive breakthroughs that push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible‚Äîwhether in business transformation, innovation, or addressing societal needs. I also serve as an Advisor for Transform, Sempervirens Venture Capital, and partnership with ON Partners. My board roles include the Advisory Board for The Mentor Project and the Board of Directors for AID International, a nonprofit empowering Haitian communities to achieve self-sustainability. I hold a master‚Äôs degree in Organizational Development from Pepperdine University, where I‚Äôm an Adjunct Professor in the MBA program, teaching Talent Management. headline: Growing company value, exit planning, M&A advisory services, investor and board member
summary: With my background of owning companies for over 35-years as well as investing in and selling business I have owned I have learned great lessons as a CPA, CFO and CEO. This firm was created to leverage my prior experience to assist business owners as a long-term trusted advisor in the business financial arena. My passion is coaching business leaders to grow revenue, margin, profit, cash flow and ultimately the value of their companies. Whether this is for a 120-year-old multi-generational family legacy company or a startup with a great idea and in need of capital, I serve the gap between the owners, CEO and finance team. I have expertise in growing companies, preparing them for a sale transition and walking them through the process of the sale. I also provide guidance with obtaining capital and optimal debt structure. During my career I have worked with hundreds of business enterprises and provided counsel to buyers and sellers of companies to maximize the value and resulting after tax cash. My passion in working with business owners has been the culmination of preparing the business for sale and successfully transitioning the ownership, with the rewards optimized for the seller. Exit Planning strategy and M&A execution are also areas of my expertise. I bring my experience in board rooms as an active and engaged board member for a select group of companies.

headline: Leadership Culture Consultant & Keynote Speaker | Building Cultures Where We Replace ME-pathy with EM-pathy ‚Üí To Build High-Trust, High-Performance Teams
summary: Leadership wasn‚Äôt built for a people-first focus. It‚Äôs time to re-engineer it. I help executives and organizations transform empathy from being seen as a ‚Äúsoft skill‚Äù into a strategic leadership advantage. Using my ROE (Return on Empathy) framework, I turn Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) into Key People Indicators ‚Äì strengthening trust, accelerating decision-making, and improving business outcomes. The truth is, organizations rarely fail for lack of strategy; they struggle because people don‚Äôt feel safe, seen, or supported. Most leaders default to ME-pathy (‚Äúunderstand me, my intent, my stress‚Äù) without realizing it. True EM-pathy (‚Äúlet me understand you first‚Äù) drives psychological safety, retention, engagement, and innovation. My Mission To prove, with data and lived experience, that ROE is the new ROI. My Journey & Expertise I began life with a lesson in belonging -- adopted at three weeks old by parents who taught me worthiness, compassion, and unconditional love. Then came male-saturated industries where those traits weren‚Äôt always valued. I watched brilliant people burn out, values get compromised, and leaders rewarded for bureaucracy over bravery. I led that way once, too ‚Ä¶ until it backfired. My breakdown became my breakthrough. What I Offer EQ Assessment + Debrief A science-backed evaluation of baseline emotional intelligence across four key areas-Self-Awareness, Self-Management, Social Awareness & Relationship Management culminating in a personalized EQ Call to ACTion that becomes each leader‚Äôs roadmap for growth. Culture Consulting (ROE Framework) My signature Return on Empathy (ROE) methodology transforms organizational culture by shifting leaders from ME-pathy to EM-pathy, strengthening psychological safety, trust and communication across all levels within your organization. Keynotes That Create a Bias for Action Dynamic, evidenced-base talks on EQ, empathy, psychological safety and trust‚Äîshowing leaders how to make People FIRST = Performance ALWAYS. Track Record - Creator of the ROE (Return on Empathy) model and International Best Selling Author - Global keynote speaker on empathy, EQ psychological safety (U.S., Africa, Europe, SE Asia) - 25+ years leading teams in engineering, construction & high-risk government projects - Leading organizations from accidental to intentional cultures, rooted in their values and aligned with their vision. - Sparring partner for leaders across STEM, Operations and Federal Government Ready to turn empathy into your next strategic advantage? Book a call üìû with me today!

We provide a comprehensive suite of services centered around the DiSC assessment, communication skills through a humanistic lens, coaching for leaders and managers, career advancement strategies for professionals from all backgrounds, and leadership development for emerging talent. company_description: Tompkins Cortland Community College is one of 30 community colleges and 64 campuses in the State University of New York system. Located in Dryden, the college serves more than three thousand students in credit programs and another three thousand in non-credit workshops and customized training. The college offers more than 45 academic programs in business, computers, health, communications, liberal arts, criminal justice, and human services. Specific degree programs include broadcast production, computer forensics, engineering science, new media, sport management, hotel and restaurant management, wine marketing, and several liberal arts programs, including education and general studies. The college attracts a diverse student body from most counties in New York State, several other U.S. states, and nearly 70 countries. The learning environment is enriched by students of all ages and backgrounds. About half of the college's graduates transfer as juniors to bachelor's degree programs at a wide variety of colleges and universities around the world, including Cornell University and Ithaca College. TC3 students study both full-time and part-time, and the college is a leader in online education. The college operates extension centers in Ithaca and Cortland. TC3 is extensively involved in our community. The college provides contract training for most major employers and provides an array of non-credit workshops designed to build skills relating to computers, leadership and supervision, personal growth, and many other areas. As a learning-centered college, TC3 is strongly committed to building on strengths to achieve student success.

headline: Speaker, Author, Professor, Coach, Faith@Work Strategist
summary: I am a practical strategist, leadership coach, author, and professor working at the intersection of faith and real-world impact. Drawing from experience as a business executive, pastor, educator, and a leading voice in the U.S. faith and work movement, I am passionate to see people fully activated and engaged in their callings, to accelerate and facilitate transformation of leaders and organizations, and for the local church to be equipped to lead people into a biblical understanding of faith, work, and economic wisdom. company_description: Welcome to the Crowell School of Business where we provide a distinctive approach to business leadership. We call it Business as Ministry. Why is this important? Because business touches every area of contemporary life from the latest products to essential services, and we can‚Äôt live without the benefits today‚Äôs companies provide. But we regularly read about corporations or even whole industries that seem to stumble from one ethics-related crisis to another. We see failures of leadership at once-trusted brands that cast doubt on pursuing business as a career. Can business be conducted in a way that benefits society, builds profitable and sustainable companies, and is consistent with Christian faith? At the Crowell School of Business our faculty believes that business may be one of the most impactful career choices available for lives of service today. Whether in a public or private company, for profit or non-profit, known brand or entrepreneurial start up, the knowledge and skills you gain at the Crowell School will be valuable for a lifetime of impact. Why are we uniquely positioned to provide this distinctive approach to business leadership? Because the Crowell School faculty along with the other five schools at Biola University take the integration of faith and knowledge seriously as it applies to business, theology, the arts and sciences, humanities and more. Few business schools work so intentionally to pull from various academic and spiritual disciplines to equip students for lives of significance and impact. At Crowell, business education is designed so you learn and put into practice career-relevant business skills while engaging your faith and launching your career. We invite you to learn more about our School and programs by following us on LinkedIn and going to our web page. Or even better: come by and visit us some time!

headline: Franchise Matchmaker | I uncover ‚ÄòBlue Ocean‚Äô franchises which are highly profitable, easy to set up and help you create financial freedom | Dozens of success stories, will you be next?
summary: I‚Äôm Keith Liscio, the Founder and President of Excelsior Franchise Center. My background and experience have uniquely prepared me to serve as a consultant and coach to prospective business owners considering an investment in a franchise system. My mission is to work with clients to winnow thousands of franchises down to a handful of good options, and ultimately the perfect business for them. I grew up in a series of small, family-run businesses ‚Äì everything from a dry-cleaning shop to a liquor store to a meat market/deli/bakery. After getting a degree in marketing from Villanova University (and later an MBA from the Wharton School) I turned my attention to the corporate world working at Fortune 500 Companies like Procter & Gamble, Nabisco, and Kraft. Eventually, I became an entrepreneur importing ceramics from Italy and then spending almost 20 years running my own Executive Recruiting firm. I was even employed by a couple of franchisees along the way, flipping burgers at McDonald‚Äôs in college and working at one of the Midwest‚Äôs leading offices for Management Recruiters International. If I‚Äôve learned anything along this journey it‚Äôs that running a business is NOT for everybody. Entrepreneurship is even tougher, taking long hours, expertise, commitment, and a high tolerance for risk. That said, business ownership can be incredibly fulfilling and offers many benefits in terms of work/life balance, financial rewards, and tax advantages. Best of all, being your own boss can be great. Really great. For many people, buying a franchise business can be the best way to become a business owner. You‚Äôre investing in an established system that‚Äôs already successful. You‚Äôre in business for yourself, but not by yourself. There are hundreds of options available allowing buyers to choose a business that capitalizes on their strengths and interests while accommodating their preferred working styles. Best of all, I know the GOOD franchises, can save you time and money, and there is no charge for my service. All my fees are paid from the marketing budgets of my franchise partners. If you‚Äôre serious about being in business, I can find one that will fit your needs. If you‚Äôd like to learn more, schedule some time on my calendar and I‚Äôd be happy to answer any questions you might have. Just click here: https://meetings.hubspot.com/keith-liscio

summary: As a Ranger-qualified and battle-tested US Army officer, I have developed the skill to operate under pressure and lead when ambiguity and chaos replace well-planned strategy and tactics. After a 30+ year career in high-tech, comprised of both start-ups and enterprises, I founded the 20/20 Consulting Group to help leaders operate their organizations. Every organization runs on an invisible operating system => the flow of collaboration, influence, communication, knowledge, and trust that determines how fast work moves and how effectively strategy turns into results. By revealing this hidden system, leaders can see their Employee Relationship Capital: the collective value of employees, and their networks, who accelerate execution, broker trust across silos, and enable influence to flow through relationships that are invisible to org charts. Org design and work can be highly tuned and strategically adapted to fluid, ever-changing conditions. Scenario planning and critical employee decisions are supported by the following: => Which employees are the connectors and bridge builders? => Where does collaboration, communication and influence break down? => Which overly connected employees are at risk of burnout? => Who are the must retain employees? => Who are the sources of innovation and knowledge sharing? => Where do investments in people deliver the highest returns? By measuring how work and information flow, leaders are empowered to make informed decisions on the human side of performance and unlock faster execution and higher economic throughput from the organization they already have. Based in Broomfield, Colorado, I‚Äôm a father, coach, and advocate for veteran leadership in business.

previous_job_description: Who We Are: I founded the You Are a GIFT Foundation to help mothers overcome prescription drug addiction and restore wholeness in their lives. After experiencing the personal loss of my daughter, I gained a profound perspective on what truly matters in life. This realization inspired a mission to provide mothers with the education, support, and resources they need to overcome addiction and rebuild their relationships and purpose. The foundation‚Äôs name, ‚ÄúGIFT,‚Äù reflects our core mission: to help individuals Reflect God‚Äôs Image and Fulfill their Talent in service to others. By empowering mothers to heal and thrive, we aim to glorify God through purposeful living. How We Help: At the You Are a GIFT Foundation, we focus on partnering with local organizations and nonprofits to address the unique challenges mothers face on the journey to becoming addiction-free. Through strategic collaborations, we provide: - Access to education and rehabilitation programs. - Tailored solutions to overcome obstacles preventing recovery. - Awareness campaigns to promote addiction prevention and family restoration. Our work is centered on offering a pathway for mothers to rebuild their lives, strengthen their families, and reclaim their purpose. Why We Exist: Prescription drug addiction often leaves mothers struggling to navigate the path to recovery alone. Our foundation exists to fill this gap by partnering with organizations to provide critical support, foster awareness, and pilot funding initiatives. Our ultimate goal is to empower mothers to overcome addiction, rebuild relationships with their families, and live meaningful, purpose-driven lives.

headline: Executive Leadership/Career Coach & Consultant
summary: The PSC (People Strategy Consulting) Team I lead provides "Workplace and People Solutions". I also serve as a Leadership/Career Coach for other consulting firms. We serve companies of all sizes, in service, manufacturing, educationand non-profit organizations to optimize their greatest asset ---their People! Partnering with our clients, we do this by selecting the best talent with cutting edge selection tools and processes, and then coach, train and develop this talent to provide their top performance that maximizes business results in a very positive, constructive work culture. Our PSC Team's expertise can help your company by: Coaching & Developing Leaders & Key Associates: Individual coaching for emerging, developing and strategic leaders, as well as, key individual contributors, in one of two ways: (1) One-on-one with a designated professional coach for a 3-9 month period, where a leadership development plan is created and implemented, or (2) by "Just-in-Time" Coaching allowing a leader to obtain a one time or multiple coaching session and support from a professional coach on a "as needed and confidential basis" for a specific issue or situation. Developing High Performance Teams and Engaging Employees: A customized Team Coaching process over a series of Team sessions is developed based upon issues and concerns the team has, as well as to address any Team dysfunctions, which all teams must overcome! Focus is on team relationships, team tasks and goals, individual accountability and a plan of action is developed and implemented. Keeping People in the Know: A plan is developed to engage the hearts and minds of your people through internal communications that inspires trust and secures commitment. Tools and ideas to help leaders in their role of enhancing communications is a major focus, as well as alternative ways to provide messages and engage all employees. Developing the Blueprint for the Future: At the organizational level, the PSC Team can help your company survive turbulent times and strategically plan for the next phase of your company‚Äôs growth. This is done by facilitating strategic planning sessions to align your company's vision, mission, people and processes, to achieve organizational goals. We also help companies create a "positive company culture" or enhance their current culture, implement change initiatives, and develop succession management processes to assure on-going leadership for the future.

headline: Leadership Reinvention Strategist | Helping Capable Leaders Operate at Strategic Altitude as the Leadership Game Changes | Author, The Delegation Cure‚Ñ¢
summary: Most capable leaders don‚Äôt struggle because they lack skill. They struggle because the leadership game they‚Äôre winning no longer scales. At a certain point, what made you successful still works but it starts creating friction. - Execution slows. - Decisions pile up. - Effort increases, but impact doesn‚Äôt compound the way it used to. That moment is an inflection point. - Nothing is broken. - Performance is strong. - But the rules of the game have changed. Most leaders respond by working harder inside the old game. That usually makes things worse. üìçI work with capable leaders and executive teams at these inflection points when growth requires a different leadership game. My work focuses on helping leaders recognize: üî∏ when they‚Äôve outgrown the game they‚Äôre playing üî∏ where their leadership model no longer fits the level of complexity üî∏ and how to update how they think, decide, and operate together so execution regains clarity, speed, and resilience This is not a performance problem. It‚Äôs not a motivation issue. It‚Äôs a leadership operating system mismatch. Where I Focus I work upstream of burnout, reorgs, and stalled execution, helping leaders shift from: ‚Ä¢ Expert leadership ‚Üí system-level leadership Designing decision architecture instead of personally solving problems ‚Ä¢ Alignment by effort ‚Üí alignment by design Reducing coordination friction and decision latency across teams and stakeholders ‚Ä¢ Heroic contribution ‚Üí scalable impact Ensuring leadership effort converts into strategic outcomes, not exhaustion Background 20+ years of experience across Asia, Europe, and the Americas, working in complex, global environments where leadership scale and system design matter. Former global talent and organizational development leader in Fortune 500 contexts, with deep experience advising senior leaders navigating growth, complexity, and reinvention. That same discernment and discipline now underpin my work with leaders at inflection points. How We Work at Potentia My work begins with diagnosis and focuses on system-level change, not heroic effort. ‚Ä¢ Leadership Operating System Diagnostic Brief (entry point) ‚Ä¢ Leadership OS Intelligence Mapping (by invitation) ‚Ä¢ Reinvention OS Lab (system-level execution upgrade) You don‚Äôt need to simplify your environment. You need a leadership system built for it. üìß nsage@potentia.cc üåê potentialeadership.com

summary: Fourteen years ago, I relearned how to walk. That experience is the foundation of my work today. It taught me what it truly takes to perform under max pressure. Now, I partner with organizations to help their people and teams in high-stakes, dynamic environments become totally unshakeable. My journey started during my recovery when I discovered a passion for the human side of performance. This led me to a stint in journalism, covering the inner workings of Major League Baseball player development for NPR. Being on the ground gave me a deep understanding of the complexity, ambiguity and risk that leaders and staff in pro sports and entertainment face every day. Then I launched my own practice, How We Won. Now I serve as the long-term strategic partner to talent at organizations in the most demanding industries, helping them build the personal and team resiliency to create winning leadership and cultures. I've delivered over 4,500 sessions to employees at top companies like Google, American Express and Warner Bros. Discovery. I‚Äôm an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC), Master Certified Coach (MCC) candidate, and QE Executive Certified Coach (ECC). I also have a B.S. in Psychology. I believe an individual's personal strength and health are the most important drivers of an organization‚Äôs success. ‚ÄúKim is more than a coach. She's a strategic partner. In my career, I‚Äôve designed and led leadership development, performance management, and career path initiatives across organizations at different stages of growth. I partner closely with executives, HR leaders, and managers to strengthen the everyday moments that define leadership: setting direction, giving feedback, navigating ambiguity, and supporting people through change. Clarity at the individual level strengthens leadership at the organizational level. Alongside my work with FutureForm, I‚Äôm open to leadership or advisory roles where I can build, evolve, or scale leadership and performance systems rooted in human-centered, practical leadership. If you believe leadership is the lever for what comes next, let‚Äôs talk.

headline: Founder at VirtueWorks, LLC | Fractional Consultant | Mindstyle Coach at The LOVELY Project
summary: If you're reading this, you're curious. Curious people are intelligent people. I thrive on curiousity. My summary used to be the same-old rote descriptions of all the things I thought I was. It included words like "strategic", "collaborator", "leadership-driven", "people-centric", and so on‚Ä¶ I AM all those things but what about the PERSON behind the ROLE? Where did she go, I wonder? Well, a COMPLETE burnout in HR during the pandemic and two, yes two, subsequent layoffs in two years, I'm finally free of the constraints our modern workplace norms have become. I would now describe myself as a former Human Resource professional who woke up one day and had enough of the games, the politicking, working the grind for someone else only to be a cog in the wheel. It became untenable. I was reminded that we really can only control the "controllables"... ... how we respond to change, the integrity with which we handle ourselves, how we manage our home & finances, how we take care of and love those who we love, and ultimately where/when/how we steward the gifts and time we've been given. Jobs will come and go but who you are in the in-between matters most. I recently read a famous quote that made my stomach turn and my pulse race ..."The majority of people die at 35 but aren't buried until 75" - I see what this represents all around me and have my whole career. People on autopilot, no self-reflecting, not thriving, not clear on their God-given purpose and direction. I believe God wants better for you and for me. You have a LOVELY calling ... ready to discover what that is? Follow my journey: The Making of Something Lovely @ www.lovelycalling.com

headline: Fractional CMO | Business Growth Advisor | Business Coach | Strategy & Marketing Expert | Helping Professional Services & Consumer Brands Scale, Differentiate & Win
summary: As a strategic advisor, coach, and consultant, I help business owners, founders, and managing partners simplify complexity, create clarity, and drive sustainable growth. I work with professional service firms, consumer product brands, manufacturing businesses, construction companies, and technology firms to develop and implement actionable strategies that fuel revenue growth, enhance profitability, and build high-performing teams. WHY MY EXPERIENCE MATTERS TO YOUR BUSINESS: I spent my career leading marketing, sales, and business development for well-known consumer brands and manufacturing firms. While my expertise began in consumer-driven industries, the principles of growth, positioning, and strategy apply universally and are just as critical for professional service firms as they are for consumer brands. Professional service firms struggle with differentiation, client acquisition, and scaling. Consumer brands focus on creating emotional connections, brand loyalty, and effective go-to-market strategies. My expertise blends both, helping professional service firms apply consumer-driven insights to win more business while guiding consumer brands to develop lasting market impact. HOW I HELP: ‚úî Growth Strategy & Positioning ‚Äì Establishing a compelling market position that drives demand and revenue. ‚úî Leadership & Team Optimization ‚Äì Helping owners develop leadership skills, structure strong teams, and build a results-driven culture. ‚úî Sales & Marketing Acceleration ‚Äì Driving lead generation, conversion, and long-term customer engagement. ‚úî Business Efficiency & Financial Strategy ‚Äì Identifying key operational efficiencies to improve profitability and scale effectively. ‚úî Exit & Transition Planning ‚Äì Preparing businesses for leadership transitions, mergers, or sales to maximize value. REAL RESULTS, REAL IMPACT: ‚úÖ Transformed professional service firms by refining messaging, improving operations, and increasing client acquisition. ‚úÖ Led go-to-market strategies that drove multimillion-dollar growth for national and global consumer brands. ‚úÖ Revitalized declining industries through strategic branding and marketing that increased market share and profitability. ‚úÖ Helped business owners scale and exit by positioning their companies for sustainable growth and maximum valuation. LET'S CONNECT: I work with business owners through coaching, consulting, and fractional executive support. If you‚Äôre looking for an experienced partner to unlock the next level of growth, let‚Äôs start a conversation.

headline: Executive Coach ‚ô¶ Leadership Team Coach ‚ô¶ Speaker and Facilitator ‚ô¶ Non-Profit Board Leader and Founder
summary: I'm Kat, a Finnish-American ICF-certified executive and leadership team coach, facilitator, and speaker with 25+ years of experience in global organizational and leadership development. I help leaders and organizations create a culture of inclusion and psychological safety where innovation thrives. My master‚Äôs degree in Mental Health Counseling informs my holistic, research-backed coaching framework. Together, we explore new perspectives and identify solutions for growth and success as well as health and well-being. In 1998, I moved from my native Finland to New York City. I was the first in my family to earn a college degree and, like many others, I craved the energy, inspiration, and diversity of life in NYC. I held career services and HR & development roles before founding my independent coaching practice. My expertise lies in international and highly-demanding professional contexts‚Äîsince founding my practice, my work has taken me to Helsinki, Rome, Bangkok, and Bonn and I‚Äôve worked with leaders based across six continents. Sisu‚Äîthe Finnish concept of resilience‚Äîand my own personal experiences as an immigrant have deeply influenced my coaching philosophy. My approach to coaching is built upon a core belief in our human capacity to learn and grow, to succeed through challenges, and live and lead with purpose. Alongside my coaching practice, I am an experienced senior non-profit founder and board leader. I have founded, led, and developed several global and local non-profit community organizations over the past 30 years. After I moved to NYC, I founded two non-profit organizations with and for Nordic women. I have served as vice-president for a global non-profit FIGT.org, and the local Finnish American Chamber of Commerce in NYC. I led the Chatham High School Marching Band Club, a registered 501c3, as President for several years. As a leader, I am driven by my values to make a difference by strengthening communities through engagement. In all my leadership experiences, I have improved the performance and structure of the board‚ÄîI am a skilled organizer known for getting things done. I lead with a strong vision and clear goals while building engagement and motivation through communication and relationship building. Want to learn more about working with me as your executive or team coach and facilitator? Send me a note!

headline: Helping leaders make clear strategic decisions amid rapid change and uncertainty | Strategy & AI Adoption Consultant | TEDx Speaker | Host of The Generalist Advantage podcast
summary: Strategy breaks down when conditions change faster than plans. I help leaders and organizations navigate complexity when the path forward isn‚Äôt fully visible ‚Äî strengthening judgment, sense-making, and decision-making as the terrain shifts. My work sits at the intersection of strategy, leadership, and human judgment. I support organizations facing high-stakes decisions shaped by uncertainty, competing priorities, organizational change, and rapid technology shifts ‚Äî including AI. Through 8Ball Clarity, I work with leadership teams on strategic clarity, decision-making, and alignment when execution alone isn‚Äôt the problem. My role is to slow thinking down just enough to create clarity ‚Äî and then help people move forward with confidence. As a Fractional Chief Strategy Officer with Scarlett Nova, I help organizations move from AI curiosity to responsible, value-creating adoption. This includes shaping AI strategy, governance, and decision frameworks that account for human readiness, risk, timing, and system-level impact ‚Äî not just tools. I‚Äôm an engineer-turned-people executive and strategist, with experience spanning manufacturing, supply chain, enterprise risk, digital transformation, and organizational development. I‚Äôm industry-agnostic by design, enabling cross-pollination of insight across systems. I also host The Generalist Advantage podcast because the world needs more of their superpowers. What clients value most: ‚úÖ Clearer decisions in complex situations ‚úÖ Stronger alignment across diverse stakeholders ‚úÖ Momentum without oversimplifying reality Fluent in English and French. Generalist by nature. Strategist by practice. Deep believer that good judgment is the most underdeveloped capability of our time. Random fact: my passport proudly displays stamps from 40+ countries. üåé Talk to me about #Strategy #AIAdoption #criticalthinking #Generalists

headline: Most Businesses Rush to AI Before They‚Äôre Ready. I Fix That. | Author, ‚ÄúAligned Before AI‚Äù | Fractional Chief AI & Systems Officer | Building Structure Before Scale for Small Businesses & Nonprofits
summary: Most organizations are drowning in tools they don't need, solving for problems they haven't defined. I help small businesses and nonprofits get aligned before AI, build structure before scale, and create systems that serve people‚Äînot the other way around. THE PROBLEM Leaders buy systems before documenting their sales process. They buy automation before clarifying workflow. They chase AI before knowing what problems they're solving. Result? Expensive technology that creates chaos, not clarity. The tech industry profits from this confusion. I don't. ALIGNED BEFORE AI I published a book by this title because I'm tired of watching businesses waste money on premature technology. CLARITY BEFORE COMPLEXITY ‚Äì Before tools, we clarify what you're trying to accomplish. Until you can articulate this, no software will save you. STRUCTURE BEFORE SCALE ‚Äì You cannot automate chaos. If processes are broken, AI breaks them faster. We build documented workflows first, then introduce technology. HUMANS BEFORE HYPE ‚Äì AI amplifies what exists. Confused teams get more confused. Aligned teams become force multipliers. WHAT I'VE BUILT As Founder of Align & Innovate, I provide fractional Chief AI & Systems Officer services to organizations needing strategic technology leadership. Before that, I co-founded Visuals by Momo, helping 50+ nonprofits tell emotionally resonant stories through documentary productions. That taught me: the best technology means nothing if you can't tell a coherent story about what you do. I bring that lens to systems work. Every CRM, every workflow, every AI strategy‚Äîit's storytelling. I also host Visual Eyes Podcast, exploring storytelling, technology, and community impact. WHO I WORK WITH Leaders tired of tools that promise transformation but deliver headaches. Leaders ready to invest in foundational systems instead of chasing shiny objects. What I don't do: Sell software you don't need. Build AI that impresses investors but confuses teams. What I do: Ask hard questions. Design systems that reduce friction. Train teams to own tools‚Äînot be owned by them. MY CREDENTIALS ‚Ä¢ AI+ Chief AI Officer Certified ‚Ä¢ Board of Directors, HandsOn South Florida ‚Ä¢ Author: "Aligned Before AI" (Amazon, 2025) ‚Ä¢ Co-Founder, Visuals by Momo I don't sell what you don't need. I help you build what works. üìñ "Aligned Before AI" on Amazon üåê aligninnovate.com | visualsbymomo.com üìß chris@aligninnovate.com üéôÔ∏è Visual Eyes Podcast

headline: Investment, Risk Management & Sustainability Expert/Speaker/Advocate/Trainer/Coach Partnering with asset owners on their Responsible Investing journey.
summary: ‚ÄúNever doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.‚Äù ‚Äî Margaret Mead, American Anthropologist The impact of climate change is seen and felt all around us. Damages from severe weather events surpassed $8 billion for 2024 alone, compared to an average of $422 million/yr. between 1983 and 2008 (Insurance Bureau of Canada). The World Bank estimates that 40 percent of the global population lives in places of high vulnerability to climate change. "Business as usual" investing could put asset owners at risk of not meeting their fiduciary responsibilities, being misaligned with rapidly evolving regulations/guidelines or simply being out of touch with their stakeholders‚Äô sustainability convictions. I am the professional you can partner with and trust on your transition from the Institutional Investor you are to the Responsible Institutional Investor you aim to become. 1-Expertise and Experience: I am a qualified actuary (FCIA, FSA) and Chartered Investment Manager (CIM) with expertise in pension plan governance, funding, investing, ESG integration and management of climate-related risks and opportunities. I have 30 years of experience with global consulting firms, portfolio managers and plan sponsors. 2-Integrity and trustworthiness: As a member of the Canadian Institute of Actuaries (CIA) I adhere to strict Standards and Rules of Professional Conduct. I received the 2022 CIA President‚Äôs Award for my groundbreaking work as Chair of the Climate Change and Sustainability Committee serving the Institute‚Äôs 6,000 members. My clients value my honest communication, my creative thinking, and my rigorous analysis. I make my clients feel heard and respected. 3- Availability and affordability: You will have direct access to my in-depth knowledge of the Institutional Investment market to solve your Responsible Investment problems and challenges. I plan to manage my client load to maintain a high level of quality. My fees are affordable in comparison to large consulting firms. The following are some of the services I offer: ‚Ä¢ Education sessions for Board, management, or members ‚Ä¢ Diagnostic assessment with gap analysis vs. peers, regulations and best practice ‚Ä¢ Governance structure review ‚Ä¢ Workshop facilitation and action plan creation ‚Ä¢ Responsible Investment (RI) policy review/formulation and implementation ‚Ä¢ Climate Strategy development and implementation NEW STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIP in 2025 WITH SAI Inc. Visit www.mathalian.com for more details or write to achoquet@mathalian.com

headline: üíéKeynote Speaker & CALM Method‚Ñ¢ Creator | I help people rebuild trust and reconnect where it matters most‚Äîat home, at work, and under pressure | Award-winning author with 20+ years frontline experience
summary: Hi, I‚Äôm Carlamay Sheremata. I‚Äôm a retired police officer, keynote speaker, award-winning author, and family conflict resolution specialist‚Äîbut more than that, I‚Äôm a bridge-builder. Between systems and people. Between leaders and their teams. Between families and the youth they love. After 21 years in law enforcement‚Äîincluding 8.5 years as a School Resource Officer‚ÄîI‚Äôve seen what happens when people lose connection. I‚Äôve watched families fracture, leaders burn out, teams implode, and kids fall through the cracks. Not because people didn‚Äôt care‚Äîbut because they didn‚Äôt know how to lead through the hard stuff. That‚Äôs why I created the CALM Leadership Method‚Ñ¢‚Äîa trust-centered, emotionally intelligent approach to leadership that works in real life. Under pressure. In crisis. In the moments that matter most. I now help corporate teams, educators, frontline professionals, and families lead with connection, rebuild trust where it‚Äôs been lost, and communicate clearly when it counts most‚Äîat home, at work, and everywhere in between. Whether I‚Äôm on stage speaking to executives, equipping frontline teams, or sitting across from a family in conflict, I bring the same message: Connection heals what correction can‚Äôt. And if we don‚Äôt fix the disconnection, we lose the people who need us most. I‚Äôm also the author of the award-winning book Youth Truth: Engaging in Conversations That Can Change Lives‚Äîa raw, practical guide that equips parents, educators, and mentors to connect with today‚Äôs youth on the tough topics that matter most. It‚Äôs not just a book‚Äîit‚Äôs a bridge between generations, emotions, and relationships. Through real stories, bold truths, and actionable tools, I teach people how to lead with clarity, courage, and compassion‚Äîwithout burning out or checking out. Because when we get connection right, everything changes. What I Speak & Train On: Trust-Centered Leadership in High-Stress Environments The CALM Method‚Ñ¢: From Reactive to Regulated Leadership Building Emotionally Resilient Teams and Families The Bridge Between Home & Work: Leading from the Inside Out Youth Truth‚Ñ¢: Conversations That Reach Today‚Äôs Kids Being Pink in a Blue World: Leading Authentically in Male-Dominated Spaces Let‚Äôs connect if you‚Äôre: A leader ready to retain your people‚Äînot lose them A team burned out from constant crisis A parent, coach, or educator ready to build trust with youth An event planner looking for a speaker who brings heart, humor, and real talk A human who believes leadership starts with presence‚Äînot position Let‚Äôs rebuild trust where it matters most‚Äîtogether.

previous_job_description: Youth Truth: Engaging In Conversations That Can Change Lives üìñ Do you know what questions to ASK your kids, students, and the youth in your life to get them to talk with you? Wouldn‚Äôt it be great to have them actually respond and engage in conversation? It really is possible! In Youth Truth, you will discover how to approach the difficult topics that need to be talked about with your kids or students. You can do it with empathy and support. You can create safe spaces where youth feel valued and heard. Youth Truth can enhance your understanding of the issues that youth are dealing with these days. That way, you will know what the right questions are and the right way to ask the questions that actually touch hearts with the young people you want to reach. This gripping book delves into the raw, unfiltered world of today‚Äôs youth. Their lives are way more complex than most realize. It is a compelling and poignant exploration of the challenges faced by young souls, bringing to light the often overlooked and misunderstood battles they fight. From the haunting shadows of suicide to the insidious presence of bullying to the silent struggles of eating disorders and the desperate yearning just to be seen‚Äìthis narrative bares it all. It is a powerful testament to the resilience, strength, and untold stories of a generation yearning for understanding and compassion. More than just a collection of stories, the author, a retired law enforcement and school resource officer, delivers a call to action, emphasizing the critical need for open, honest, and compassionate conversations. Youth Truth highlights how listening and engaging in meaningful dialogue can profoundly impact the lives of young people.

headline: On-Demand HR Partner for Skilled Trades & Service Based Business | Practical HR Support for Small, Growing Businesses | I Help Make HR Simple, Clear & Manageable
summary: I‚Äôve spent my entire career inside HR. But the people I care about most aren‚Äôt sitting in corporate boardrooms. They‚Äôre running skilled trades and service businesses. They‚Äôre out in the field early, managing crews, juggling schedules, solving problems in real time ‚Äî and doing everything they can to keep the work moving and their people supported. And almost every one of them has said some version of the same thing to me: ‚ÄúI know HR matters‚Ä¶ I just don‚Äôt have the time. And honestly, I‚Äôm not even sure where to start.‚Äù That‚Äôs exactly why I founded On Demand HR Solutions. Small, growing trades businesses don‚Äôt need corporate HR theory or overbuilt policies that don‚Äôt fit how the work actually gets done. They need simple, practical HR support ‚Äî delivered in a way that works alongside the business, not on top of it. That‚Äôs where I come in. I work as an independent on-demand HR partner for skilled trades businesses, and I offer a few clear ways to get support, depending on what you need right now: HR SOS Session A focused, one-hour working session to tackle one specific HR issue ‚Äî a people problem, compliance question, hiring concern, or ‚Äúthis just came up and I need help‚Äù situation. HR Blueprint A short-term, hands-on engagement to put the HR foundations in place ‚Äî clear policies, better hiring and onboarding, and simple systems that bring structure and consistency to how you manage your crew. HR Advisory Ongoing HR support for owners who want a trusted partner in their corner ‚Äî someone they can call, message, or loop in when questions come up, decisions need to be made, or issues start to surface. No over-engineered solutions. No corporate speak. No judgment. Just honest, practical HR support designed for businesses where the work happens in the field. I believe HR should make running a business easier ‚Äî not harder. If you‚Äôre not sure which option makes sense, that‚Äôs okay. Most people aren‚Äôt. Send me a message here on LinkedIn and tell me what‚Äôs going on. I‚Äôll help you figure out the simplest next step. üì• Message me on LinkedIn ‚Äî I‚Äôm just one DM away.

job_description: After more than 30 years leading HR in complex corporate environments, I started noticing a pattern. Most owners don't want to ‚Äúdo HR.‚Äù They just wanted the work to run smoothly, their crews supported, and their business protected. So I founded On Demand HR Solutions to meet them where they are. Today, I work as an on-demand HR partner for skilled trades and field-based businesses, helping owners put practical HR systems in place that actually work in real life. My focus is HR operations and people management that supports how trades businesses run day to day. That includes everything from hiring and onboarding crews, to setting clear expectations, handling employee issues, and staying compliant as the business grows. I step in where HR usually falls through the cracks and help bring structure, clarity, and consistency without overcomplicating things. previous_job_description: While my title at Integra LifeSciences changed over 16 years, the constant was transformation. As HR Manager, I supported global operations, quality, regulatory, and commercial sales teams, leading recruitment and retention strategies, launching training programs, and guiding leaders through performance management and employee relations issues.
